when_to_say: Used to express feeling fatigue.
example: 仕事の後で疲れる。 (shigoto no ato de tsukareru.) - I get tired after work.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone intelligent.
example: 彼女はとても賢いです。 (kanojo wa totemo kashikoi desu.) - She is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to refer to companions or friends.
example: 私の友達は親切です。 (watashi no tomodachi wa shinsetsu desu.) - My friends are kind.

when_to_say: Used to describe playing or having fun.
example: 子供たちは公園で遊んでいます。 (kodomotachi wa kouen de asondeimasu.) - The children are playing in the park.

when_to_say: Used to describe something excellent or great.
example: 彼の演奏は素晴らしいです。 (kare no ensou wa subarashii desu.) - His performance is wonderful.

when_to_say: Used to describe something excellent or great.
example: 彼の演奏は素晴らしいです。 (kare no ensou wa subarashii desu.) - His performance is wonderful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinking something.
example: 水を飲む必要があります。 (mizu o nomu hitsuyou ga arimasu.) - You need to drink water.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone intelligent.
example: 彼女はとても賢いです。 (kanojo wa totemo kashikoi desu.) - She is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to express difficulty or being in a bind.
example: 宿題が多すぎて困る。 (shukudai ga oosugite komaru.) - I’m troubled by too much homework.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or quickness.
example: その車は速いです。 (sono kuruma wa hayai desu.) - That car is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone intelligent.
example: 彼女はとても賢いです。 (kanojo wa totemo kashikoi desu.) - She is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to describe something excellent or great.
example: 彼の演奏は素晴らしいです。 (kare no ensou wa subarashii desu.) - His performance is wonderful.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone intelligent.
example: 彼女はとても賢いです。 (kanojo wa totemo kashikoi desu.) - She is very smart.

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinking something.
example: 水を飲む必要があります。 (mizu o nomu hitsuyou ga arimasu.) - You need to drink water.

when_to_say: Used to express difficulty or being in a bind.
example: 宿題が多すぎて困る。 (shukudai ga oosugite komaru.) - I’m troubled by too much homework.

when_to_say: Used to describe something excellent or great.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to describe playing or having fun.
example: 子供たちは公園で遊んでいます。 (kodomotachi wa kouen de asondeimasu.) - The children are playing in the park.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: この問題は難しいです。 (kono mondai wa muzukashii desu.) - This problem is difficult.
